fields.description:
(Original summary: "Add the "create sub-task" option in the ellipsis button of the new issue view")

Currently, in the new issue view, we have the quick add buttons for add sub-tasks. Using this button only gives you the ability to specify a *summary* for each new sub-task. 

This is a useful feature to create sub-tasks quickly. However, it would be also useful if we have an option to create sub-tasks using the full Create Issue popup, so that additional fields can be entered.

h3. Work around

If you have configured your project to require specific fields when a sub-task is created, the form will open as it did in the Old Issue View.
fields.summary: Provide a way for users to pop open the full Create Sub-task form from the New Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Typing comments is slow on the New Issue View.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an issue in the New Issue View.
# Start typing a comment
# As fast as you start typing the comment, it will be lagged

h3. Expected Results
It should not have any lag on it.

h3. Actual Results
It's lagged to add comments.

h3. Workaround
In the Old Issue View adding comments works fine.
fields.summary: Typing Comments in the New Issue View is Lagged

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If a user is created where the user key that would already be assigned to them automatically is take (this can be by a removed user as the user_key is never removed for history tracking) the new user is given a user_key matching the ID number of their database record such as *ID12345*.

This mismatch combined with older record causes certain JQL functions that use data in the *changeitem* table to work to ultimately fail to return valid records. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create user1.
 # Take actions to populate entries in the *changeitem* table. (Change assignee or reporter is a good one)
 # Remove user1.
 # Create user2.
 # Ensure user2 has the same username as user1 and a different user key. 
 # Take actions to populate entries in the *changeitem* table. (Change assignee or reporter is a good one)
 # Search for the user2 using a JQL function that uses the *changeitem* data. (eg. 'change TO')

h3. Expected Results
Results return in JQL

h3. Actual Results
 !Screenshot 2019-07-01 at 13.55.29.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Searching for a user in JQL using 'changed TO' or similar function fails if the user_key does not match the lower_user_name because the user_key has already been used.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
h3. Environment

Any Jira software cloud instance with Portfolio installed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # add the Team or Parent Link field (or both) to a default issue screen
 # navigate to <cloudurl>/secure/BrowseProjects.jspa
 # you are unable to populate the fields the drop down is missing:

 
h3. Expected Results

You should be able to populate these fields
h3. Actual Results

You are unable to:
 !image-2019-06-25-16-06-58-746.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround:

navigate to <cloudurl>/secure/Dashboard.jspa and try again :)

!image-2019-06-25-16-09-48-079.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Unable to select Portfolio custom fields when creating an issue off /secure/BrowseProjects.jspa

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
[Wiki markdown editor in New Issue View|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/the-new-jira-issue-view-938040503.html] does not have a built-in tools to add indentation.

h3. Suggested resolution
Implement the ability to add indentation to texts in multi-line fields (e.g Description) in New Issue View.
fields.summary: Ability to add indentation in multi-line fields in New Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the new issue view, there's a lag in rendering when typing a comment in the comment section
 [^bandicam 2019-07-01 15-32-51-956.mp4] 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a Jira issue (make sure you're in the new issue view)
# Start typing a comment into the comment section

h3. Expected Results
Each characters render as they're type

h3. Actual Results
There's a lag in rendering the characters

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Lag when typing a comment in the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement
Due to securities concern, we do not allow the user to download report outside our office. The users should be able to only view the documents, and not copy, download, etc.

h3. *Suggestion* 
Allow tracking from audit logs and disabling the following Attachment feature 
- copy 
- copy as the image
- download of files and documents.
fields.summary: Allow disabling attachment download from the issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Copy a Bitbucket PR URL directly from the development panel and paste as a comment into a Jira issue doesn't work due to a strange hash that is added into the URL. 
h3. Environment
 * Jira Cloud
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Go to the development panel and copy the URL of a Bitbucket pull request and paste as a comment into a Jira issue.
 
h3. Expected Results
If the user clicks in the URL, the user will be able to access the pull request properly.
h3. Actual Results
A message appears asking the user to try another account.


h3. Workaround
Copy the URL directly from the repository.
fields.summary: Copy a Bitbucket PR URL directly from the development panel doesn't work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If the user name of the user is different from its user key in the database, the *separation of duties* condition will be ignored.

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a *Separation of duties* condition in a transition *Y* (e.g. user cannot perform this transition if he's perform *X* transition);
# Have a user perform the transition *X*;
# Have the same user try to perform the transition *Y* that has the condition.

If that user is able to perform all the transitions, this is possibly caused by the bug.

h3. Expected Results

The user should not be able to perform the transition *Y* if it has performed the transition *X*.

h3. Actual Results

The condition is ignored, and the user will be able to perform all those transitions.

h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: Separation of duties condition is ignored if user's username is different from the user key

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A rendering problem/miss-rendering will occur if a table has empty cells (*only space inside it*).

* From the new view to the old view:
 !Screen Shot 2019-06-28 at 15.50.49.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2019-06-28 at 15.50.57.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2019-06-28 at 15.51.12.png|thumbnail! 
* From the old view to the new one:
 !Screen Shot 2019-06-28 at 15.49.52.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2019-06-28 at 15.50.14.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a table (new view, or old view);
# Leave one or more cells with only a *space* inside it.

h3. Expected Results

The cells will be correctly rendered when switching between the views.

h3. Actual Results

When converting from the old view to the new view, there will be empty content displayed where those cells were supposed to be.

When converting from the new view to the old one, those cells will not be displayed, and the cells' order will be scrambled.

h3. Workaround

Adding the following content will force Jira to scape it, rendering the cell correctly:
* *space* *two reverse bars* *space*:
  !Screen Shot 2019-06-28 at 16.00.37.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2019-06-28 at 16.00.46.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2019-06-28 at 16.00.55.png|thumbnail! 

Additionally, while editing in the new issue view, you can simply type a character in a filled cell and the empty cells will be filled as normal "squares".
fields.summary: Conversion problem from old view to new view (and the other way around) when there are empty cells in a table

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion
In some cases, it would be nice to be able to use multiple filters on a single dashboard gadget, so that the results of each of them could be compared. Being able to use multiple filters in a *Pie Chart* gadget, for an example, could bring benefits to users who rely on dashboards to track their work.
fields.summary: Allow multiple filters to be used in Dashboard Gadgets

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an issue is accessed through a filter/search using the new issue view, there's an option to go back to the project of that issue as you can see in the image below:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

If we use *Command* + *Left click*, the following behavior is experienced:
 !Screen Shot 2019-06-28 at 09.59.39.png|thumbnail!

The redirection on a new tab happens, but the current page is redirected to an undefined page.
h3. Environment

Cloud - Jira - New Issue View - Issue Navigation through search
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access an issue through a filter using the new issue view
 # Command + Click on the project name next to the issue key

h3. Expected Results
A new tab is opened and redirected to the project page and the current page stays at the same page.

h3. Workaround
Right click on the project name and select *Open in a new tab*
fields.summary: Command + Click on Project name through a search/filter using the new issue view redirects to undefined page

fields.description:
Email notification should include old and new project keys both when an issue is moved from one project to another even when it is a batched one.

After the changes that have been made after this https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/blog/2019/02/jira-emails-are-changing , 
the old project key and new issue key is not showing up in the email notifications. In the old issue view, it used to show like -P1-T1- => P2-T2
fields.summary: Batched email notification should include old and new project keys both when an issue is moved from one project to another

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users are unable to use the date time picker field in the sub-task creation via the new Jira issue view. 

h3. Environment

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a date time picker custom field and enable it for a project.
 # Change the field configuration for that custom field to be required. 
 # Open a standard issue with the new Jira issue view.
 # Create a sub-task. Since there is required field, the create form will pop-up
 # Try to click on the calendar icon for the data time picker custom field. 

h3. Expected Results

The picker should work. 

 !old view.png|thumbnail! 



h3. Actual Results

The custom field does not work and a browser console error is returned. 

{code}
batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&jag=true&locale=en-US:5057 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'DEF_DATE_FORMAT' of undefined
    at new Calendar (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&jag=true&locale=en-US:5057)
    at n (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&jag=true&locale=en-US:5060)
    at HTMLAnchorElement.<anonymous> (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&jag=true&locale=en-US:5060)
    at HTMLAnchorElement.dispatch (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&jag=true&locale=en-US:82)
    at HTMLAnchorElement.h (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&jag=true&locale=en-US:74)
{code}

 !new view.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

The field itself does not need to be required.

Having any other field required (even with the *field required* validator) will do. The date picker calendar will not work in the sub-task create screen in any scenario.

The *Date Picker* field type is also affected.

The same behavior can be observed when creating *Tasks* under *Epics*

h3. Workaround

option 1 : Switch to the old view on the parent issue and create the sub-task from there. 
option 2 : Force the calendar to load
- Click on the create (+) icon from the sidebar. Click on the calendar for any date time picker field and cancel.
- Try to create the sub-task again and the date time picker should start working. 

option 3: Directly enter the date time picker value following the site time zone format. For example the format, dd/MMM/yy h:mm will be entered as 22/Jan/20 05:10 PM
fields.summary: Date time picker fails on sub-task creation in the new Jira issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using a post function to copy Component field value from another custom field in the Create issue transition does not assign the issue to the component lead.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a component and set the default assignee to Component lead
 # Add a copy a custom field value to the Component field in the Create issue transition
 # Create an issue

h3. Expected Results
Issue is assigned to Component Lead
h3. Actual Results
Issue is not assigned to Component Lead

h3. Workaround
Fill in the Component field directly instead of copying the value from another field
fields.summary: Post function to copy Component field from Custom field while creating issue does not assign the issue to Component Lead

fields.description:
h3. Summary
So there's a difference in how the changelog works for labels field as compared to other fields such as the "Component" field. The component field doesn't show the 1st value where as the Labels field shows the original value and new value.

h3. Similar field types
1. Component
2. Affected versions
3. Fixed Versions
4. Attachment
5. IssueLinks
6. SubTask links
7. WorklogId

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create an issue.
* Add a components field to it
* Add a labels field to it.
* Then Add 1st value to the component field, and a 2nd Value to the components field.
* Do the same for the Labels fields, by adding the 1st and 2nd value.
* See the history tab.

h3. Expected Results
* There should be a consistency in how Jira shows the history as compared to other similar field types such as Component, as that doesn't shows the history of multiple values added
via REST API : /rest/api/3/issue/<issue_key>/changelog
{code}
field	"Component"
fieldtype	"jira"
fieldId	"components"
from	null
fromString	null
to	"10010"
toString	"Server"
{code}

h3. Actual Results
* The Labels field shows the history of every value added where as other fields using similar field type doesn't show such history

via REST API : /rest/api/3/issue/<issue_key>/changelog
{code}
field	"labels"
fieldtype	"jira"
fieldId	"labels"
from	null
fromString	"web"
to	null
toString	"python web" 
{code}

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. As some users / vendors might depend on this inconsistency in how their Integration reads the "Labels" field.
fields.summary: An inconsistency with how Jira handles the Labels field in Change History as compared to other System fields of similar types

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When users are trying to download attachments of issues while using the "New Jira Issue View", Jira will download the file in its  "original", without extension. The issue is inconsistent, as it does not occur on all issues but on certain issues created

h3. Steps to Reproduce
(!) Not always reproducible (!)
* Create an issue, go to the comment and upload an image
* Open an issue while using the "New Jira Issue View" ([link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/the-new-jira-issue-view-938040503.html]);
* Try to download an attachment from the attachment field.

h3. Expected Results
* The name and the extension of the file is retained.

h3. Actual Results
* Jira will show the file in its "original" name and remove its extension.


h3. Workaround(s)
Switch back to the old UI from the *Personal Settings* by doing the following: 
# Click on your avatar picture (bottom left corner of the screen) and select "Personal Settings", or just navigate to: https://XXXXXX.atlassian.net/secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa
# In the "Jira Labs" section, click to disable the New Jira issue view
fields.summary: Jira doesn't show attachment file name and extension on certain issue in new UI

fields.description:
Jira provides the ability to set custom user properties via the following :

https://<site>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/user/EditUserProperties.jspa?name=<user>

Document Reference : https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/edit-user-project-roles-jira-applications-only-744721647.html

At the moment, it is not possible to update the user properties via REST APIs in Jira cloud. 

Suggestion :
Option 1 : Provide an option to update the current User properties via API
Option 2 : Allow custom properties for Atlassian Account to support custom properties that can be used by Jira. 

Additional suggestion:
1. Migrate legacy user properties to user entities.
2. Provide UI to update user entities.
3. Update custom fields of "User property" type to reference user entity.
fields.summary: Jira user properties API

fields.description:
We are utilizing a Jira add-on called Pivot Reports. We need to utilize Jira Portfolio's Team field in Pivot Reports. But the support team for Pivot Reports said that Atlassian is not exposing that field via API so they cannot do anything about it.

Here is a feature request to expose Portfolio Team field via APIs for other Add-ons like Pivot Reports to use.
fields.summary: Expose Portfolio Team field via APIs for other Add-ons like Pivot Reports

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When making calls to "/rest/api/user/search?query=", the query value can only find forward substrings.
For example, if the user has an email "example@test.org", the search "query=exam" will return the user, however the search "query=xample@test.org" will not return the user.

As a consequence, searching for users by email such as "query=@test.org" will no longer return users as it used to. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use the endpoint to search for existing users by email domain.

h3. Expected Results

The users with the substring are found

h3. Actual Results

The expected users are not returned.

h3. Workaround

Currently, the best workaround is to use the endpoint /rest/api/3/users/search to page through all users, then use the "self" attributes that are returned to get the details of each user. Finally, filter the results as desired.
fields.summary: REST API user search query no longer finds substrings or wildcards

fields.description: The ability to use colspan attribute when building table using ADF. Currently, it would show correctly in the new issue view, but the field would be empty in the old issue view. Because of that, when the issue is exported to HTML format, the field came out empty.
fields.summary: Able to support colspan attribute when building table using ADF

fields.description:
h3. Description
When viewing a dashboard in *Wallboard mode*, gadget titles are displayed. For some gadgets such as the *Filter Results* gadget, the gadget's title does not provide useful information. 

Instead, for some cases showing the title actually takes space that could be used to show information about the gadget.
*  !Screen Shot 2019-06-27 at 11.19.13 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Improvement Suggestion
It would be good if users could manually toggle on/off the gadgets' titles, deciding whether to this play this information or not.

Currently, all gadgets' titles are displayed by default, setting that cannot be changed.
fields.summary: Create option to show/hide Gadget Title on Wallboard Mode

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update—1 June 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

We have created a new ticket for this issue that specifically tracks this issue for > 120 attachments. The new ticket will remove the noise from the current ticket where the issue has been resolved for some users but not for others.

We will close off this ticket and ask that anyone still affected by this issue to vote/watch the new ticket: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-74515

Thank you for your continued support as we work to improve the new issue view in Jira.
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update—4 May 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
We have rolled out an improvement which allows Jira to reliably handle 120 attachments per issue. We expect this to solve the problem for ~75% issues currently affected. 

We are continuing to consider a longer-term fix and will keep you updated in this ticket.
{panel}
h3. Summary

If you attach a large number of attachments on an issue the new issue view fails to load them.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Attach more than 150 attachments on an issue.
 # Try to view the attachments on issue view.

h3. Expected Results

Attachments load and the thumbnails of attachments are visible on the issue view.
h3. Actual Results

Attachments show "Failed to load" error. 
h3. Workaround

The attachments load successfully in the old issue view. Please disable the new issue view via *Avatar > Personal settings* and toggling the switch for the *New Jira issue view.*
fields.summary: New issue view fails to load attachments when there are too many attachments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When viewing an issue in the "old" view and trying to sort the comments, the page breaks and the comments are changes to show the issue on the new view.

*  !comments sorted.png|thumbnail! 

The issue seems to be replicable in all browsers (tested on Firefox, Safari, and Chrome)


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access an issue in the old view;
 # Click on the sort button

h3. Expected Results

The comments should be sorted

h3. Actual Results

The page breaks and the comments are changes to be the view of the issue in the new issue view

h3. Workaround

A workaround will sort the comments using the new issue view
fields.summary: Sorting comments of issue in the "Old" view breaks the page

fields.description:
h3. Description
With the New Issue view rapidly in place on Atlassian Cloud, as a team, we would like to have an option in choosing how we receive notification between the Old and new style notification.

The email batching feature actually groups emails to reduce the notification noise, but at the same time, there's a timeframe or rather delay in which this notification is received and we want notifications to be sent out immediately rather than grouping it.

h3. Suggestion
We would like to have an option on Cloud Administration to decide whether to use the old style notification which comes in immediately a change is done or use the new style notification which actually groups emails despite changes done per minute on a ticket. So this feature should allow us, turn off or on depending on our preference.
fields.summary: Option to choose between batched and non-batched notifications

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using the new issue view, adding users in multi user picker field shows duplicate users

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Add 2-3 users in a multi user picker field
- Refresh the page > some of the users will be duplicate
- The issue does not occur in old issue view

h3. Expected Results
Users in the multi user picker field should not show duplicate users

h3. Actual Results
 !Screenshot 2019-06-27 at 13.52.55.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Use the old view.
fields.summary: When using the new issue view, adding users in multi user picker field shows duplicate users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Date and Date time custom field work inconsistently as they respect different application time zone setting. Date field types respect UTC time zone setting while the Date time field type respect the user profile settings.

h3. Environment
Jira cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two custom fields of type Date and Date time
# Go to profile setting
# Change time zone to Sydney (could be any zone)
# Now set a date on both fields created above (This has to be done before 10 am Sydney time).

h3. Expected Results
Both fields have the same date configured

h3. Actual Results
The Date field is set behind the Date time field because it uses UTC

h3. Workaround
Use only the Date time field to avoid inconsistency.
fields.summary: Date and Date time custom field inconsistent (respect different time setting)

fields.description:
{panel:title=Case Note|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#000000|titleBGColor=#e2ada1|bgColor=#a1d6e2}
h2. *Problem Statement*
Only "Add Internal Comment" option available when viewing Service Desk Issue via Mobile

h2. *Steps to replicate*
# Go to https://<instance>.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/mobile?
# Click on a Service Desk issue
# Scroll down and attempt to add a comment and share to customer

h4. *Expected Result*
Able to Share to customer comments 

h4. *Actual Result*
"Share to customer" option isn't available in the mobile view (https://<instance>.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/mobile?)

h3. Workaround
- Use Desktop view by typing https://<instance>.atlassian.net/browse/<issue> on the address bar OR
- Download Jira Mobile App: [Jira Cloud Mobile \- The Official Jira App from Atlassian|https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/mobile-app]
{panel}
fields.summary: Only "Add Internal Comment" option available when viewing Service Desk Issue via Mobile

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you try to import a CSV, and the project role *Developers* is registered in the instance as "developer" (minor case), Jira throughs an error:
{code}
Unexpected failure occurred. Importer will stop immediately. Data may be in an unstable state: Failed to add users to 'Developers' role for the project 'TRI': Errors:
Unknown macro: {name=A project role with name 'Developers' already exists.}
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Check if the project role "Developers" was renamed to _developers_
 # Try to import a CSV file

h3. Expected Results

The import should work correctly since the developer role exist.

h3. Actual Results

Import fails with an error

h3. Workaround

A workaround will be to rename the project role to *Developers*
fields.summary: Error during CSV import when project role "developers" have lower case

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As a Project Manager, I want to be able to forward an email into JIRA and
 have it create a sub-task under a specific issue.
h3. Suggestion

Send an email to Jira, specifying the issue key of the target issue, as well as a suffix like *(sub-task)*.
fields.summary: Ability to create sub-tasks via email

fields.description:
h3. Description
On the new Media viewer, the decision was made to only request an image at a size of 1920x1080 dimensions, to load faster for the end user and improve performance, and the user can download the image to see it in the full size.
So, when using the new issue view and clicking in one attached image, the browser is using the endpoint '/file/fileId/image' to get the image and performing the following request:

{code}
https://api.media.atlassian.com/file/<cloud-id>/image?allowAnimated=true&client=<client-id>&height=1080&max-age=3600&mode=fit&token=<token>&width=1920
{code}

However, if the image is bigger than 1080x1920, the image is going to look pixellated.

h3. Suggestion for Improvement
It would be nice to have a higher quality and size image to preview to the user.

h3. Why is this important
This behavior may be a recurring issue when some instances have a huge amount of images bigger than 1080x1920.
fields.summary: Improve image quality on the new Media viewer
On pressing Enter Key, time tracking window that appears after clicking log work should log time and close

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The description field does not display in the app when the description is very long but it does show in the web 
h3. Environment
Mobile app
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a long description to an issue
 # View the issue in mobile app

h3. Expected Results
The Description field shows the exact value it shows on web view
h3. Actual Results
The Description field shows as empty

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Description field in Jira apps does not show when the Description is long

fields.description:
Currently, when an issue is cloned, it copies over the same assignee as the source. It would be helpful if assignee can be removed during the cloning.

It may conflict with the permissions set by project admins to stop people from assigning the issues to someone else.
fields.summary: Remove assignee while cloning an issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
External System Import not mapping to label fields in Next Gen projects

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a new field of the type label in a next-gen project (lets say a field called secondLabel)
# Create a csv with the following fields - "Issue Key","Summary","secondLabel"
# Use External system import to import the issues from the CSV to the Nextgen project

h3. Expected Results
Value from the csv column secondLabel is mapped correctly to the field secondLabel

h3. Actual Results
No errors are thrown during the csv import and values  from the csv column secondLabel are mapped correctly to the field secondLabel.

h3. Workaround
The import maps the values correctly to the Jira label field. If this is feasible map the labels to the Jira label field instead of a custom field of the type label.
fields.summary: External System Import not mapping to label fields in Next Gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* Primary field collection not showing in Jira mobile.

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud with mobile with a Business project.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a screen tab with fields (see screenshot) on a Business project.
 !2019-06-25_17-30-25.png|thumbnail!  !2019-06-25_17-31-02.png|thumbnail! 
# Access an issue which uses this screen on Jira mobile.

h3. Expected Results
* The created fields are shown in Jira mobile.

h3. Actual Results
* The created fields are not shown in Jira mobile.
 !Screenshot_20190625-173652.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
* Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Primary field collection not showing in Jira mobile.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When the cursor is on the far-left side of the notification or search panel, scrolling would result in the background page to be scrolled rather than the notification panel itself. 

For example:
When cursor at the far left:
 !image-2019-06-26-10-09-54-280.png|thumbnail! 

When cursor on the panel:
 !image-2019-06-26-10-10-56-810.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the scrolling to work on the panel when the cursor is at the far left

h3. Workaround 
Make sure the cursor is on the panel
fields.summary: Scrolling on the left panel will scroll the background page if cursor is on the far-left.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

"Copy Value From Other Field" post function is not working to copy Custom text fields from parent issues to sub-tasks.
h3. Environment

Jira CLOUD
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a text custom field (Multiline) and add to all issue type screens in your project
 # Configure the post function "Copy Value From Other Field" in an In progress status of your project workflow
 # Set the post function to copy the text custom field value from the parent to sub-task
 # Save your draft
 # Create a task and add value to the text custom field
 # Create a sub-task linked to the created task
 # Transition the task to "In progress" in order to trigger the post function

h3. Expected Results

The text custom field should be updated in the Sub-task issue.
h3. Actual Results

The sub-task is not updated.

 
h3. Workaround

None so far.
fields.summary: "Copy Value From Other Field" not working for Text custom field from Parent to Sub-task

fields.description:
h3. Description
When configuring workflows. It is possible to configure post functions to update custom fields. In some post functions, such as the *Update Issue Custom Field*, there exists the option to *Append* a value to the field.
*  !Screen Shot 2019-06-25 at 5.29.33 PM.png|thumbnail! 

The problem is that this option may be misleading, as in scenarios where the field being updated *already has a value*, running the transition will cause the field to be *overwritten* by the value defined.

h3. Suggestion
It would be good to have this particular scenario highlighted, in order to prevent undesired changes. On an ideal scenario, the message displayed could be changed to:
* If set, the given value will be appended to the field. 
* If the field is a multi value field, the new value will be added.
* If the field already has a value, it will be replaced by the new value.
fields.summary: Improve "Append value" feature's Conditions and Considerations

fields.description: Using the old view, users can move from one attachment to another using the left/right arrows but these arrows don't exist to the new view. We would like to have the same ability to move from one image to another using side arrows.
fields.summary: Ability to move from one image to another using side arrows

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When configuring workflow post functions, it is possible to use built in macros such as '%%CURRENT_DATETIME%%' and '%%CURRENT_USER%%'. In post functions to update custom fields, the *Append value* feature allows users to append a given text to the current field content.

The append feature works as expected when appending the '%%CURRENT_USER%%' macro to a text field, but it does *not* work for '%%CURRENT_DATETIME%%'.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a text custom field
 # Add a *Update issue Custom Field* post function to a workflow transition
 # Configure it to append the *%%CURRENT_DATETIME%%* macro to the field
 # Save the workflow draft
 # Run the transition.

h3. Expected Results
Just as when a *text value* is added to the post function or even the *%%CURRENT_USER%%* macro, the current date should be appended to the field.

h3. Actual Results
If this macro is used, the whole content of the field is replaced instead.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Append Feature does not work for '%%CURRENT_DATETIME%%' in text Custom Fields

fields.description:
In the new issue view, images are compressed when previewing, which forces users that want high resolution in preview to download.

This means that at high zoom levels, users cannot quickly preview since the result is highly pixellated.

The old view let you zoom in upon previewing an image and kept the original resolution intact.
fields.summary: Improved Zoom Resolution in Image Preview

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After disabling the watch issues, the option is still available on the Jira application for Android.

h3. Environment
Jira Mobile

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Jira settings > system > general configuration
# Click edit settings 
# Set "Watching" to "OFF"
# Scroll to the bottom of page
# Click "Update"
# Open an issue from the same Jira instance in the mobile app
# Click the "..." in the upper right
# Notice "Watch" appears as an option, even though it should not since "Watch" is "OFF"
# Tap the "Watch" action
# Notice an error displays "Something's gone wrong..."

h3. Expected Results
The option is not available.

h3. Actual Results
The option is still available in the screen and if you click on it, it throws an error.

h3. Workaround
Currently, none.
fields.summary: Even with Watch Issues Disabled, the Option is still Available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently , for the new batch notification format is not following "Email From" setting from the General Configuration. When user received the notification , the from stated *Jira* instead of *${fullname} (Jira)*
h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Trigger a few event to trigger the JIRA notification


h3. Expected Results
The "email from" using below format
{noformat}
${fullname} (Jira)
{noformat}
h3. Actual Results
The "email from" is *Jira* . Refer the screenshot below :-
 !Screenshot 2019-06-25 at 5.32.55 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-jira-application-options-818578873.html

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Batch Notification format for "email from" is not following the General Configuration setting

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if a user with a German preferred language enters into a number field, eg: 100.1
Jira will display that the number is invalid and would only accept 100,1
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow user defined number separator
h3. Workaround 
Use a text field instead of a number field
h3. Why is it important
Switzerland users would also use German language and the current decimal separator for the language "," while the Swiss uses "."
fields.summary: Allow user defined decimal separator

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When receiving a batching notification from Jira, label updates don't have whitespace between them - one long green background block.
 It looks like all labels are concatenated (refer to the screenshot).
 !Screen Shot 2019-06-25 at 11.12.57 am.png|width=729,height=304!
fields.summary: Add whitespace between labels in batching notifications

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When viewing a parent issue with sub-tasks, it isn't possible to transition the sub-task directly from the parent issue screen, it is needed to access the sub-task and transition it. 

h3. Suggested resolution

Create the ability to transition the sub-task directly from the parent issue screen.
fields.summary: Ability to transition sub-task from the parent screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you have a format on the issue description, that is not recognized by the new editor, the description of the issue didn't appear on the Jira mobile app.
One way to reproduce the issue is to create an issue through email, where brackets are added in the bottom of the description causing the format to be unrecognized. 
Clicking on the issue description, we can see a warning message about the formatting not recognized. 

* !error in de description.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue through email;
 # Check if you get a warning about the format no recognized;
 # Try to access the issue on the Jira mobile able

h3. Expected Results

The description of the issue should appear in Jira mobile

h3. Actual Results

The issue appears without its description 

h3. Notes

h3. Workaround

A workaround will be editing the description of the issue, in the web version of Jira, to remove the unrecognized format, in order to view the description on Jira mobile app
fields.summary: Unrecognized format on Jira issue description impact it on the mobile

fields.description:
h3. Summary

There is currently no way of retrieving the *People* of a Project, that is to say, the configured Project roles and users included in the Project.

h3. Proposed solution

This data can be included in the output of a *GET* {{*/rest/api/3/project*}} response. Giving you all the users found on the Project's *People* settings.

Currently, the endpoint provides the configured Project roles but not the users with the role.
fields.summary: Include People in GET Project API response

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In a dashboard, if there are multiple gadgets and if gadgets are set to use different colors then when viewed as wallboard, the content of the gadgets is overlapped.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a dashboard with multiple gadgets (for example, use *Filter counts* for Service desk)
# For the gadgets added, use different layout/outline colors.
# View the as wallboard using the option *View as wallboard*

h3. Expected Results
The content of the gadgets should be displayed without any issues.

h3. Actual Results
Gadget content is overlapped

h3.Workaround
The workaround is to set the layout color of all the gadgets to the same color. However, using this workaround has a limitation where only one of row gadget data is shown in a screen
fields.summary: Gadget data is overlapped when viewed as wallboard

fields.description:
Issue - List of issues appearing after applying an advanced filter does not have any option to edit single issue

How to replicate - Apply any advanced level query and click on three dots adjacent to any ticket. The popup has all the option however edit is missing.

Adding an edit option that opens the ticket in a new tab is suggested
fields.summary: List of issues appearing after applying an advanced filter do not have any option to edit single issue

fields.description:
As a user I would like to be able to see issues within a swim lane categorised in a particular order that is required for the board so that I don't have to use a range of custom filters instead.

E.g.,
 
_Parent Swim lane based on component type, Child swim lane based on user_ 
 * Component a
 ** User 1
 *** Issues....
 ** User 2
 ** User 3
 * Component b 
 ** User 1
 *** Issues....
 ** User 2
 ** User 3
 * Component c...
fields.summary: Swim lanes with swim lanes (pools)

fields.description:
h3. Issue description
Gadget or a feature  to obtain the last update date of a project, in one page.

h3. Why is it important.
It helps the Admins determine which of the project is not in use. Helps in better cleane up process.
fields.summary: Gadget or a feature  to obtain the last update date of a project, in one page.

fields.description:
When there is a long text in the editor and you scroll down, editor panel (formatting options, etc.) does not stay on the screen. So, when you work on the bottom of the text and want to use some formatting, you should all the way up.

This works on old view.
fields.summary: New Issue View - Make Editor Ribbon Sticky / Fixed

fields.description:
I would that clicking in *Advance search for issues* redirect to a blank screen search instead of a starred filter. 
 !Screen Shot 2019-06-21 at 18.37.18.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2019-06-21 at 18.37.40.png|thumbnail! 

With the current behavior, there's the risk I might accidentally save over my filter (something that has happened before).
fields.summary: Advance search for issues is redirecting to starred filter

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you add a comment with a backslash "\" it gets duplicated if the comment was added using the new issue view. When you switch to the old view, you see the backslash duplicated


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access an issue
 # Using the new issue view, add a comment that contains a backslash "\"
 # On the new issue view, the comment will appear normally
 # Switch to the old issue view
 # The comment appears with the backslash duplicated

h3. Expected Results

The comment would behave the same on both views

h3. Actual Results

Backslash get duplicated when switching to the old issue view.

h3. Notes


h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be using the old view when adding a comment with a backslash
fields.summary: Issue coment with backlash get it duplicated

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
Currently users could set the access level of next-gen projects to *Open*, *Limited* or *Private*. As JIRA site admin I would like to disable and enable the access levels options globally for all next-gen projects.

h3. Suggested resolution
Implement the ability to disable and enable access level options for next-gen projects.
fields.summary: Ability to disable/enable access levels for next-gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If you try to use *Sprint was in closedSprints()* in your JQL, this will break Jira and give a 500 error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add {{Sprint was in closedSprints()}} to your query and search
# Refresh the page

h3. Expected Results

I would expect either results, no results or an error that says the JQL function is not supported.

h3. Actual Results
You get this error and the page will crash if you refresh

{noformat}
Error occurred communicating with the server. Please reload the page and try again
{noformat}

 !Oops_-_an_error_has_occurred.png|thumbnail! 
 

h3. Notes.

Interestingly enough, if you add *EMPTY* to the query, you get a more expected behaviour which is an error message and it doesn't break the page.

 !Issue_navigator_-_JIRAempty.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
None, adjust your JQL to {{*Sprint in closedSprints()*}}
fields.summary: Using was in closedSprints in your JQL breaks Jira

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Windows with keyboard language set to Russian/Ukrainian, when a user enters some text and tries to undo changes using Ctrl+Z nothing happens. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set the keyboard language to Russian. 
# Create a test issue
# Add some text to the issue in the new issue view and try to undo the change.

h3. Expected Results
Users should be able to undo changes.

h3. Actual Results
Ctrl+Z doesn't work and not able to undo changes.

Notes: Ctrl+z works and users are able to undo changes in the old issue view.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: For non-English languages Ctrl+Z/Undo does not work in the new issue view on Windows OS

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When users update a part of the custom field text of an issue, the new Jira notifications will have the complete description (in Red) and complete description (in Green) with the changes made by the user.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a test issue
# Add a custom field (for example a multiline text field with *Wiki Style Renderer*)
# In the issue, add some text to the custom field. Update the same text with minor changes.
# Jira notification received shows the complete description twice.

h3. Expected Results
Jira notification should have only the changes made/updates in green.

h3. Actual Results
Complete description with updates will be shown in green.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: New Jira notifications emails highlights the complete text when only a part of the text block is updated.

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Statement*
User that "Has access on site"-only (deactivated user) isn't able to send email to create issues or comments to project with permission Group(Anyone) 

h3. *Steps to Replicate*
# Invite a user through *User Management*
# Enable "Has access on site" only without giving the application access to any Jira product. 
# Create a project and grant "Create Issue": Group (Anyone, including non-registered and anonymous users)
# Set Incoming Mail Handler to the Project
# Using the user's mailbox, Send email to create an issue to the project

h3. *Expect Result*
"Has access on site"-only users are able to create The user is part of the "Anyone, including non-registered and anonymous users" which has permission to create user. 

h3. *Actual Result*
Issue isn't created

h3. Workaround
Delete the user from the User Management
fields.summary: User that "Has access on site" only (deactivated) isn't able to send email to create issues or comments to project with permission Group(Anyone)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Whenever you try to link an issue with a Confluence Home page, it produces an error message

h3. Environment
 * Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on *Link*
 # Click on *Confluence Page*
 # Choose a Confluence page URL that's the homepage of a Space

h3. Expected Results

A proper link

h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
We're having trouble. Check your connection and try again
{noformat}

h3. Notes
Linking a Jira issue to a standard, non-Home page works just fine

h3. Workaround

Workaround from [~mstramaglia1]:
{quote}
As a workaround for now, we've found that if you use the Jira macro in Confluence to add the Jira ticket to the Confluence page, it will appear in the list of "mentioned" pages on the Jira ticket, even if it is a Space Home page.
{quote}
fields.summary: Linking a Confluence Home Page in an Issue produces an Error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

New editor doesn't save the comment/description if using Shift+Enter and changing the entire text color at once.

h3. Environment

New issue view/Markdown editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Using the new view, add text on comment or description and instead of Enter to add a line break, use Shift+Enter.
# Change the text color by selecting all text.

h3. Expected Results

The comment is saved.

h3. Actual Results

It shows the error below:

We couldn't save your comment
It might be empty or have invalid formatting. If you copy-pasted, try removing the formatting and adding it directly in the editor.

h3. Notes

If we change the color line by line it works normally, but selecting all text to change the color, it fails.

h3. Workaround

Change the color line by line.
fields.summary: New editor doesn't save the comment/description if using Shift+Enter and changing the color of the text (Unsupported content)

fields.description:
h3. *Issue Summary*
Performing a Bulk move operation throws an error that prevents moving the issue to the new project. This is caused when a Workflow Step in the target project has been missed which causes the error.

h3.*Environment*
Jira Cloud

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*

{panel:title=Reproducing the Problem|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
 # Create a Project A, create parent issues and sub-task issues
 # Create Project B, create parent issues and sub-task issues
 # Let both project have similar workflow with One Status that is distinct between both Project.
 # Try to Bulk Move Project A issues into Project B and upon request to map status that is different, choose the new status that is different in Project B.{panel}

h3.*Expected Results*
The issue should be moved as the correct status was mapped during the move.


h3.*Actual Results*
An error occurs stating the below
 !bulk.png|thumbnail! 

The below exception is thrown in the log file:
{code:java}
com.atlassian.jira.bulkedit.operation.BulkOperationException: java.lang.RuntimeException: No step associated with status Closed in new workflow Software Simplified Workflow for Project COM
	at com.atlassian.jira.bulkedit.operation.BulkMigrateOperationImpl.perform(BulkMigrateOperationImpl.java:114)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bulkedit.BulkEditTaskRunnerImpl.runTask(BulkEditTaskRunnerImpl.java:118)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.progress.ProgressAwareMessageRunner.lambda$processMessage$0(ProgressAwareMessageRunner.java:106)
	at com.atlassian.workcontext.metrics.Timer.timeWithException(Timer.java:143)
	at com.atlassian.jira.consistency.ConsistencyCheckServiceImpl.lambda$wrapWithTimer$3(ConsistencyCheckServiceImpl.java:141)
	at com.atlassian.jira.consistency.ConsistencyCheckServiceImpl.wrapWithTimer(ConsistencyCheckServiceImpl.java:146)
	at com.atlassian.jira.consistency.ConsistencyCheckServiceImpl.runWithException(ConsistencyCheckServiceImpl.java:61)
	at com.atlassian.jira.consistency.ConsistencyCheckBuilderForRolloutService$TypeAwareRollout.runTheCode(ConsistencyCheckBuilderForRolloutService.java:140)
	at com.atlassian.jira.consistency.ConsistencyCheckBuilderForRolloutService$TypeAwareRollout.with(ConsistencyCheckBuilderForRolloutService.java:162)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.progress.ProgressAwareMessageRunner.processMessage(ProgressAwareMessageRunner.java:107)
	at com.atlassian.jira.messagequeue.MessageRunnerServiceProvider.lambda$null$1(MessageRunnerServiceProvider.java:255)
	at com.atlassian.messagequeue.internal.core.NestedMessageConsumer.consume(NestedMessageConsumer.java:122)
	at com.atlassian.messagequeue.internal.sqs.SQSMessageConsumer.consumeMessage(SQSMessageConsumer.java:245)
	at com.atlassian.messagequeue.internal.sqs.SQSMessageConsumer.processReceiveMessageResult(SQSMessageConsumer.java:195)
	at com.atlassian.messagequeue.internal.sqs.SQSMessageConsumer.run(SQSMessageConsumer.java:122)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: No step associated with status Closed in new workflow Software Simplified Workflow for Project COM
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.OSWorkflowManager.migrateIssueToWorkflowNoReindex(OSWorkflowManager.java:748)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.OSWorkflowManager.migrateIssueToWorkflow(OSWorkflowManager.java:722)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.OSWorkflowManager.migrateIssueToWorkflow(OSWorkflowManager.java:1199)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bulkedit.operation.BulkMoveOperationImpl.moveIssueInsideTxn(BulkMoveOperationImpl.java:277)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bulkedit.operation.BulkMoveOperationImpl.moveIssuesAndIndex(BulkMoveOperationImpl.java:223)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bulkedit.operation.BulkMigrateOperationImpl.perform(BulkMigrateOperationImpl.java:99)
	... 17 more
{code}

h3. Workaround
* Ensure that the target project has the same Status as the Source Project. If the workflow are completely different Contact [Support|https://support.atlassian.com] to help determine the Status that has been missed, as this can be seen on the logs.
fields.summary: Bulk Move Operation  Error - No Step Association to Status

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Have the option to include the value of one field to another. 
For example: having the contents of the description field quoted
in a reply to the customer. So if the description is "Server B is running
low on memory", when I add a comment and press Respond to Customer, it
shows "Server B is running low on memory as well as whatever my reply was.

h3. Expected Results
Have this feature of copying/including.

h3. Actual Results
There isn't an option to perform that.
fields.summary: Have the Option to Include the Value from First Field to Another After Adding Value to a Second Field

fields.description:
Hi Team,

It would be great if we change the MaxResult value from 1000 to 5000 via rest api without using pagination.
fields.summary: Increase MaxResult value from 1000 to 5000 via rest api without pagination

fields.description:
I think that the summary says it all (: this suggestion was a wish from our client Axfood @ axfood.atlassian.net and I feel like it would be a nice feature as well - perhaps as a "toggle" that can be activated/deactivated as well.

 

And also, perhaps add a Component that is "Agile board" or similar? (did not find any good/really matching components, which are mandatory)
fields.summary: As a user I would like to get the latest comment of an issue as a tooltip on mouseover in an agile board

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Issue links are not shown in the new issue view when  the link is for the issues via a third party Add-on

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install add-on ex: Xray Test Management for Jira add-on.
# In the new issue view, create an issue with the issue type Test set.
# In the new issue created, click on Create Test to create a new Test issue.
# The new test issue created do not show up under issue links in Test set issue.

h3. Expected Results
When a Test issue is created in Test set issue, the new issue created should be shown as an issue link.

h3. Actual Results
New test issue does not show up in issue links

h3. Workaround
As a workaround, for now, users could use the old issue view to create test issues and the same shows up in issue links.
fields.summary: Issue links are not shown in the new issue view when  the link is for the issues via a third party Add-on

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If the project key was changed, issues on the new issue view will not open

h3. Environment
* Cloud
* New issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Change the project key and save it
# Try to access an issue *on the new issue view*

h3. Expected Results
The issue should open

h3. Actual Results
The URL will change from the new project key to the old project key automatically and the page will refresh
 
h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3. Workaround
* Access the issue on the old issue view
* OR clear browser cache. Issue doesn't happen on private/incognito mode.
fields.summary: Issues are not opening on New Issue View if the project key was changed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the "old issue view", whenever users tried to create an attachment from a file straight from the clipboard (by pressing ctrl-v), Jira would open a pop-up and allow users to name the newly created attachment.

In the "New Jira Issue View", Jira will upload the attachment with a pre-defined name (_filetype___date___attachmentid_).

*Furthermore*, if the attachment was created using the old view and then viewed in the new view, all attachments will be named the same ("Screenshot-1", for example).

The video below better illustrates the problem:

[^JRACLOUD-72300.mp4]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # While viewing an issue using the old view, upload an attachment straight from the clipboard and give it a name;
 # View the same issue using the new view

h3. Expected Results

The name defined in the old view remains while viewing the issue through the new view.
h3. Actual Results

Jira will display a generic name on the attachment.
h3. Workaround

No current workaround
fields.summary: In the New Jira Issue View, if an attachment is uploaded directly from the clipboard, Jira won't allow you to name the attachment

fields.description:
h3. Description
When working with workflows, it is possible to create validators based on *Regular Expressions*. However, unlike other validators such as the *Field Required* validator, it is not possible to create *custom error messages*.

h3. Suggestion of Improvement
The default error message may not be as informative as it could. It would be nice to have the ability to create a custom error message as a way of ensuring that, if a transition failed because of a validator, the user would know exactly how to proceed to prevent it from failing.

h3. Why is this important
Having this would make the process of transitioning issues more user friendly in case something failed. 

Being able to define a custom message allows users to create a more straightforward answer.
fields.summary: Add Custom Error Message feature to Regular Expression Validator

fields.description:
If 2 items in the dropdown are the same, you cannot distinguish between them


I added the title in the Span to show how this might work below

!image-2019-06-19-16-04-31-911.png!



 

Even in this create issue screen this would help. It looks like there is more info that would be nice to be able to see.

!image-2019-06-19-16-08-56-060.png!
fields.summary: On dropdowns such as Status, if there is a "..." then when hovering show the enitre text

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The "tabs" feature has recently been implemented in the "New Jira Issue View" (as per this [Feature Request|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-69983]). However, there is a scenario where, if the tab contains many fields and the bottom fields contain a dropdown menu, this menu will be outside the view of the user. The video below better illustrates this behaviour:

 [^JRACLOUD-72297.mp4] 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Access a project where there is a tab with many fields on it and the bottom fields contains a dropdown menu.

h3. Expected Results
The dropdown menu is displayed upwards.

h3. Actual Results
The dropdown menu is displayed downwards, making it impossible for the user to select the option.

h3. Workaround
Either disable the "New Jira Issue View" by performing the following steps:

# Click the profile icon, on the bottom of your left sidebar, then *Personal settings*;
# On the "Jira Labs" section, click to disable the *New Jira issue view for software projects*.

Or zoom out your browser.
fields.summary: In the New Jira Issue View, if there are many fields in a tab, the most bottom fields won't display drop down menus correctly

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unable to link Confluence page to an Issue that has not been previously viewed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Go to an Issue and click on *Link a Confluence page*
# In the search bar, start typing an existing Confluence page or Space

h3. Expected Results

List of Pages or Spaces from Confluences that match the strings should appear on the list of results.

 !_SCRUM-460__651_-_JIRA_epic.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

If you haven't viewed the page prior to doing this, it will not come up in the search results.

 !_SCRUM-460__651_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 
 !_SCRUM-460__651_-_JIRA_empty.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes

This is due to an existing bug with the fabric editor in Confluence that has been reported in CONFCLOUD-66569.

h3. Workaround

You can still scroll through the list to find the page. Should you need the search to work, by accessing the Page or Space on Confluence, it will appear in the search results.
fields.summary: Unable to link Confluence pages which have not been previously viewed

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As a user, I want a feature to allow the user to accept the assignment

Customers want a feature to allow the user to accept the assignment
fields.summary: Introduce a feature to allow the user to accept the assignment

fields.description:
h4. Situation
Issue fields in Basic Search of the Issue Navigator can only be found by the translation of how those fields were created. The same field in the Advanced search (or JQL), can only be found by the original value. This will enable team 

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Set the Default language of JIRA to English
# Set the user language of JIRA to example:  Dutch
# Search for the system field "key"
# Through the Translated field, the Dutch translation for "key" is "Code"
# However, you can't be able to use "Code" to search for an Issue. e.g. code=IT-55

h4. Expected result
When searching for issues through the Advanced Search in the issue navigator (or other searches using JQL) for field "Code", the previously generated issues should be found

h4. Actual result
No issues can be found with field "Code". However issues can be found with "key". This is because JQL is only getting the fields in its original language as the System fields are all in English, so the translated field doesn't exist.
fields.summary: Ability to allow JQL to use translated fields in Advanced Searching Query

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the activity stream gadget, filtering the issues by issue created does not return all results. Some activities on the stream are missing

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
#Add activity stream gadget to dashboard
# Filter the stream by issue created
# Create a few issues and monitor the activity stream

h3. Expected Results
All issue create show up on the activity stream

h3. Actual Results
Some issue don't show on the activity stream

h3. Workaround
Set the activity stream gadget limit to 99 which is the maximum limit possible. All activities will now show.
fields.summary: Filter by issue created on activity stream not showing all result

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unable to bulk move sub-tasks to another issue type using move operations.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 * 1. Create a project and create sub-tasks on it;
 * 2. In the issue navigator, search for:
{code:java}
project = "XXX" and issuetype = Sub-task
{code}

 * 3. Perform a bulk move from sub-task to another issue type;

h3. Expected results

The sub-tasks are moved to the other issue type.
h3. Actual result

The sub-tasks are not moved and the error "The issue type selected is invalid" is shown on the page.
 !Screen Recording 2019-06-18 at 05.04 PM.gif|width=507,height=214!
h3. Workaround
 * 1. Access the ticket itself;
 * 2. Click *More •••*, then *Convert to Issue*; (Note, this will not work for next-gen tickets, currently)
 !Screen Shot 2019-06-18 at 17.08.37.png|width=784,height=145!
fields.summary: Unable to bulk move sub-tasks to another issue type

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you are editing a comment of an issue if you leave the issue page, get back to it, then try to edit the comment by just saving it, the editions unsaved are lost. This happens on the new issue view.

Steps to Reproduce

# Click to edit a comment on a ticket;
# Leave the page (without save or cancel the edition);
# Get back to the issue;
# Click to edit the comment where the comments weren't saved;
# Click to save the comment.

h3. Expected Results

The unsaved changes will be saved and shown on the comment

h3. Actual Results

The unsaved changes are lost, even if you try to edit the comment again

h3. Notes 

h3.Workaround

If you add a small change to the unsaved changes of the comment (space or a point) the editions aren't lost when the comment is saved.
fields.summary: Unsaved changes are lost when you get back to edit the comment

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the Keyboard shortcuts only work with standard English letter keyboard and no shortcuts work if the input language is set to some other language. Keeping the keyboard shortcuts constant on the keys would greatly benefit users when using another language in Jira Cloud. 
h3. Suggested Solution

Keep the same shortcuts independent of the input language.
h3.
fields.summary: Support keyboard shortcuts for other languages keyboards

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When hiding the sidebar in the issue navigation, the resize icon will not follow the other elements. See the recording:  [^Resize bug.mp4] 

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Perform a search;
# Switch to *Detail view*;
# Hide the sidebar.

h3. Expected Results

All elements will follow the page's resizing.

h3. Actual Results

The resize button will stay absolute in the page.


h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: Resize icon does not follow the other elements when the sidebar is hidden in the issue navigation

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Issue created via e-mail sometimes shows a different user in the issue history than the real reporter. The issue history in old issue view for the issue says that it was created by a@company.com. The reporter of the issue shows b@company.com. The new issue view doesn't show the created issue entry.

h3. Root cause Identified
This is a rarely occurring bug in the code that handles incoming email. When multiple emails arrive shortly after each other and are processed together, they will all appear to have been created by the reporter or the first email.
fields.summary: Issue history shows different user than configured in e-mail handler

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there's an incident where user attaching credit card information to JIRA instance. Credit card information is confidential, by right it shouldn't be provided.

h3. Suggested Solution
It's best for JIRA if it has scan feature to automatically remove the attachment if it contains credit card number information.

h3. Why this is important
This is to assure JIRA user didn't get confidential information from customer. 

h3. Workaround 
No workaround.
fields.summary: Ability to scan attachment information

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you are using the Two Dimensional Filter Statistics gadget or Average Time in Status Gadget and it has a team-managed (formerly next-gen) in the filter, it will show the status of all the team-managed (formerly next-gen) and company-managed (formerly classic) Project, even if they have the same name.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a dashboard and add the Two Dimensional Filter Statistics gadget.
 # Use a filter that returns both company-managed (formerly classic) and team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects.
 # Select the Y and X axis as Project and Status

h3. Expected Results

The gadget loads the issues per status, for an only different status.
h3. Actual Results

It returns all statuses, even those with the same name.

!Same Status.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Use different gadgets for team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects and company-managed (formerly classic) projects.
fields.summary: Two Dimensional Filter Statistics and Average Time in Status Gadget Repeats Status if Returning team-managed (formerly next-gen) Projects

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to a project and click "Issues and filters" -> "Open issues"
# Confirm that the basic search is activated
# Switch to Japanese IME and type "toukyou"

h3. Expected Results
"とうきょう" will be shown. The search won't be triggered because the character confirmation is not done

h3. Actual Results
"とうきょう" will be shown and the search is triggered with that criteria
 
h3. Notes
* To check the expected result, try typing the same "toukyou" in advanced search mode. It will just show the dropdown to confirm the character and search won't be triggered
* In Chrome, hitting Enter key after the "Actual Results" re-enters the same text in the search window

h3. Workaround
Click "Advanced search" to access the site level search screen and enter the search terms there
fields.summary: Issue search triggered before confirming the character to use in Japanese

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On the New issue view, if you added the property *jira.permission.scheduleissue.projectrole* with any project role on the key, it disables the ability of the users to add comments on the ticket. 

h3. Environment

Jira cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add workflow property to a status:
#* Property value: jira.permission.scheduleissue.projectrole
#* Property key: Administrators
# Transition the issue to that status

h3. Expected Results

On that status, the due date should be restricted to be edit only to the members of the Administrators project role. 

h3. Actual Results

On the new issue view, the edit comment is removed for all users. 

h3. Notes

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be use the "old" issue view
fields.summary: Status property for due date block the ability to add comments

fields.description:
I talked to a customer who is using next-gen projects, she is trying to add a cumulative flow widget to her dashboard but is struggling because the widget is showing a scrolling list of fields with the same name. 

This is because for next-gen projects, the fields are contained within the projects since the company has multiple next-gen projects with fields of the same name it becomes virutally impossible to understand which field belongs to which project.

 

h3. Workaround

The workaround is to try out every single field to see if it belongs to the correct project.
fields.summary: Duplicative/Confusing fields in dashboard widget for next-gen

fields.description:
When having the time display format set to *Pretty* under the *Time tracking settings* and trying to log hour using the *Hours* format, the error message thrown is not indicating why is not possible to log hour using the *Hours* format.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Set the *Time display format* to pretty:
 !Screen Shot 2019-06-14 at 11.33.34.png|thumbnail! 
# Create an issue an try to log hours using the *Hours* format:
 !Screen Shot 2019-06-14 at 11.34.35.png|thumbnail! 
# The following error is thrown on the UI: 
*We couldn't save your changes*
Check your connection, then give it another try.
 !Screen Shot 2019-06-14 at 11.34.24.png|thumbnail! 
However, on the console:
{code}{"errorMessages":["Worklog must not be null."],"errors":{"timeLogged":"Invalid time duration entered."}}{code}

h3. Expected results
The error message should be more clear and specify which error the user is getting.
fields.summary: Error message for time tracking should indicate which is the format of the required input

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Running [PUT /rest/api/3/mypreferences|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-rest-api-3-mypreferences-get] REST API to set *user.keyboard.shortcuts.disabled* user property breaks user's properties in JIRA database and throws a 500 error whenever user access JIRA.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Run a [PUT /rest/api/3/mypreferences|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-rest-api-3-mypreferences-get] REST call to set *user.keyboard.shortcuts.disabled*. For example:
{code}
curl -X PUT \
     https://<site-name>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/mypreferences?key=user.keyboard.shortcuts.disabled \
     -H 'Authorization: Basic <base64token>' \
     -H 'Accept: application/json' \
     -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
     --data '<true/false/1/0>'
{code}
# Access JIRA

h3. Expected Results
Be able to access JIRA

h3. Actual Results
500 error appears

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Set preference REST API does not work for user.keyboard.shortcuts.disabled property

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using the "User Is In Any Project Role - Condition to allow only users in a given project role to execute a transition." condition in a workflow does not show up in "View Usage" in Project Roles 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add condition - "User Is In Any Project Role - Condition to allow only users in a given project role to execute a transition. " in a transition > Select the project role > Publish
 # Go to "https://<SITENAME>.atlassian.net/secure/project/ViewProjectRoles.jspa" > View Usage > Does not appear in the "Workflow" section that the Project role is associated to the condition

h3. Expected Results
When using "User Is In Any Project Role - Condition to allow only users in a given project role to execute a transition." condition the project role used in the condition should appear in "View Usage" in "https://<SITENAME>.atlassian.net/secure/project/ViewProjectRoles.jspa" 

h3. Workaround
Use "User Is In Project Role-Condition to allow only users in a given project role to execute a transition. " condition in the workflow
fields.summary: Using the "User Is In Any Project Role - Condition to allow only users in a given project role to execute a transition." condition in a workflow does not show up in "View Usage" in Project Roles
The REST API endpoint to create a project is not working as documented and still accepts usernames

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Icons like priority don't match on Jira and Slack. This confuses user and leads to inconsistency on both UI.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Integrate Jira and Slack
# Now create an issue in Jira
# Look at the priority icon in both Jira and slack.

h3. Expected Results
The priority icon on both Jira and Slack match

h3. Actual Results
The icons don't match.

h3. Fix
Standardize Jira and Slack icons
fields.summary: Jira and Slack integration icons don't match
